alert.note: Alert for Wilkinson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 29 at 9:51PM CST until further notice by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Louisiana and southern Mississippi, including the following counties and parishes, in southeast Louisiana, East Feliciana, Pointe Coupee and West Feliciana. In southern Mississippi, Amite and Wilkinson. * WHEN...Until midnight CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 951 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Centreville, Woodville, Gloster, Wilson, Norwood, Spillman, Wakefield, Fort Adams, Batchelor and Lettsworth. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
